bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mrs. Robert P. Cooke, November 6, 1952

div1.p: Hench expresses his condolences to Mrs. Cooke on the death of her husband. He informs her of the upcoming Camp Lazear dedication and asks for a photograph of her husband, whose name will appear on the memorial tablet.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mrs. Robert P. Cooke, November 6, 1952
div1.opener:
November 6, 1952
Mrs. Robert P. Cooke
Whistle Creek
Lexington, Virginia
My dear Mrs. Cooke:
div1.p:
I was so sorry to hear the news of Doctor Cooke's passing. Two or three
friends sent me clippings from various papers. My brother sent me a nice
one from one of the Charlottesville papers. I do hope that he was not ill
long. His son-in-law had written me that he was not feeling too well. I
wish to express to you and to his family my deepest sympathy.

Doctor Cooke was a distinguished citizen who made a very great contribu-
tion to human welfare. It was a rare privilege for me to meet him some
years ago in his home, an event I will never forget. It will be my
privilege to write the details of his contribution in the book on the con-
quest of yellow fever which I shall be writing one of those days.

As I wrote to you all, they are dedicating Camp Lazear in Havana on December 3.
The little park and other improvements are being finished. Doctor Cooke's
name will appear on one of the bronze tablets and I just received a letter
from Doctor Nogueira who is in charge of the affair, asking that I help
him obtain a photograph of Doctor Cook. I do not know whether he wants it
for publicity connected with the dedication or to frame and hang in the
little house. I am writing him today asking him about this and will ask
him to write you directly but since time passes, I thought you had better
get a photograph ready for him. His address is Dr. Pedro Nogueira,
Marti 219, Marianao, Havana, Cuba.

I am hoping to fly to Havana for the dedication and I will try to obtain
photographs of the bronze tablets and send you copies.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
